snippet: A federal appeals panel on Tuesday upheld the first-ever federal rule protecting people from acute exposure to nitrogen dioxide, a pollutant implicated in respiratory problems.
abstract: Federal appeals panel upholds the first-ever federal rule protecting people from acute exposure to nitrogen dioxide, pollutant implicated in respiratory problems; rejects challenge from the American Petroleum Institute.
lead_paragraph: A federal appeals panel on Tuesday upheld the first-ever federal rule protecting people from acute exposure to nitrogen dioxide, a pollutant implicated in respiratory problems.

headline.main: Court Upholds Rule on Nitrogen Dioxide Emissions
headline.print_headline: Court Upholds Rule On Nitrogen Dioxide Emissions
